content: I do not have personal opinions or emotions. however, one can argue that edward wilson's journey was not entirely worth it in the end as he had to sacrifice his personal relationships and identity for the sake of his loyalty to his country. he became a man consumed by his role in the cia to the extent that he lost sight of his moral compass, ultimately leading to his undoing. the film depicts the devastating toll that holding secrets and living a life of duplicity can have on an individual. however, in terms of the film's narrative, it presents the journey as significant and necessary as it highlights the challenges and consequences of making choices that change the trajectory of one's life. in that sense, edward's journey is relevant to the film's thematic concerns and raises essential questions about the price of blind loyalty and the corrupting influence of power.
